data.title: Generational Changes but still Tasty ....
data.text: I have been coming to Fong's since 1978 and once I left the area I always craved their unique brand of Mandarin chicken not found on the west coast. I have popped in here every time I visit to get my fix. The original owner got into some legal trouble and the place was closed for a while much to my disappointment and on another trip we found them closed due to construction issues.Anyway I was back in town and they were open, I read a few reviews and almost tried another spot because they were so negative.So I showed up for lunch about 11:30 on a Friday, I was greeted by three employee's and I was the only customer in the place. It was clear there had been some changes in decor and staff, but I ordered my favorite lunch special Mandarin Chicken with white meat and it was excellent as well as the shrimp fried rice and egg roll. I was very pleased.I was a little sad that throughout my visit not another person entered the restaurant, clearly this place has lost it's mojo but on my visit everything was excellent,including service, lets hope they return to the days I remember in my youth !!!

data.title: Finally back open after 7 months of being closed!!! I missed my Mandarin Chicken and Won-ton Soup
data.text: They just opened back up for business but the dining area was not quite organized. Tables were just kind of placed here and there in no particular order. I am not sure if they are still waiting for deliverys like table clothes for the tables or new tables etc... I suppose soon they will have it all organized. They need to build them some shelving so they can organize things. The dining area should not be cluttered with items setting on tables in the corners, such as plates and utensils and news papers. All of this stuff should be placed out of the dining area. Since they just opened back up, I suppose they were just in a hurry to get the doors back open and up and running for business. No pictures on the walls yet either.  New paint and new ceiling. All new kitchen equipment etc... The food is excellent and you get large portions for your money. We have been eating at Fongs for 35 years and no other chinese place can hold a candle to the food at Fongs. The Won-Ton Soup is awesome!!!! All the dishes we have ever eaten here are always fantastic!!!

data.title: GOOD Place for Chinese
data.text: Good place for Chinese, though they could clean up the place a little bit. Good value on combo platters.

data.title: Most Authentic Chinese Food in the Area!
data.text:
My wife and I avoided Fong's for years -- then finally gave it a try. We have been goinf back regularly for the last five years!  We have both eaten at Chinatown restaurants in New York City -- and Fong's is the most authentic Chinese food we've had in Louisiana! Elderly Miss Mae and Stephen the waiter are a delight.  Yes, the place is cluttered, but it is NOT dirty! Try and of Fong's house special soups -- they are a meal in themselves.
 We live in Kenner and try to get to Fong's once a week. Richard & Robyn

data.title: Do not eat there
data.text: need to be closed down. Old building, rats and mice. Food not good.  Owners are terrible people. Do not go there to eat. There are better Chinese places to eat in area.

data.title: Good food, terrible atmosphere
data.text:
I have passed this place for years, and today I decided to give it a try.

Food is not terrible, but the restaurant is horrible.  Dirty, old and uncomfortable.  My table had a nice comfortable chair and a "card table" chair.  Table was not cleaned.  While I was there late for lunch (around 3:00) the place was empty aside from a what I presume was a family member who kept yelling about a veterans home somewhere in the area.

Food was promptly served, and was tastee.

Would I go back . . . HELL NO!

data.title: Absolutely the best Chinese food
data.text: Very authentic and excellent Chinese food.  Looks aren't everything but the food is superb!  All the usual favorites plus some. The crab rangoon is great.  Lunch specials.
